document.docTitle: Charaea houjayi Bezdek & Lee, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Charaea (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) from Taiwan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Charaea (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae) from Taiwan

heading.emphasis:
Charaea houjayi Bezděk & Lee
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Taiwan , Nantou County, Hsitou,
23 ° 40 ′N
120 ° 47 ′E
.

Comparative material examined of
Charaea chujoi
(
Figs 49
, 107–112 , 125 ).
28 specimens
— JAPAN : Ehime Pref.:
1 ♂
3 ♀♀, Kumakougen-cho, Ishizuchi-Skyline,
4 .ix. 2007
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH );
1 ♂
, Tobe-cho, Iwayaguchi,
10 .vi. 2008
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH );
1 ♂
3 ♀♀, Imabarishi Ohmishimacho, Miyaura lake- Tutigadaira,
10 .vi. 2007
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH ); 1 ♀, Tobe-cho, Iwayaguchi,
19 .vi. 2009
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH ); 1 ♀, Matsuyama-shi, Kamenono,
27 .v. 2007
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH ); 1 ♀, Hojo-shi, Takanawa Mt.,
22 .– 23 .viii. 2009
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH ); 1 ♀, Kumakougen-cho, Mt. Ishizuchi,
25 .vii. 2010
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH ). Kagawa Pref.: 2 ♀♀, Mannoucho Nakadouri, Mt. Daisenzan,
29 .vii. 2007
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH ). Okayama Pref.:
1 ♂
1 ♀, Kurashiki-shi, Muko-yama Mt.,
15 .vi. 2003
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH );
1 ♂
1 ♀, Kurashiki-shi, Sakazuhachiman-yama Mt.,
23 .vii. 2005
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH ); 2 ♂♂ 2 ♀♀, Maniwa-shi Hiruzen, Orogatawa,
20 .vii. 2003
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH );
1 ♂
, Maniwa-shi Hiruzen, Kamitokuyama,
7 .vii. 2007
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH );
1 ♂
, Souja-shi, Tsuki,
19 .viii. 2007
, H. Suenaga leg. ( HTCH );
1 ♂
, Tsuyama-shi, Kamocho Kuroki,
1 .vii. 2007
, S. Sejima leg. ( HTCH ); 2 ♀♀, Kasaoka-shi, Mushima,
8 .vii. 2007
, S. Sejima leg. ( HTCH ).

Male. Anterior part of head impunctate, glabrous (except short setae below antennal insertions). Interantennal space 1.15 times as wide as transverse diameter of antennal socket. Interocular space 2.60 times as wide as transverse diameter of eye. Antennae filiform, 0.70 times as long as body, length ratio of antennomeres equals 13 - 6-7 - 12 -
12 - 12 - 12 - 12
- 12 - 12-18 .

Pronotum lustrous, 1.30 times as broad as long, widest in anterior third, covered with fine punctures. Anterior margin slightly concave, lateral margins rounded, posterior margin widely rounded with middle part straight. Anterior margin very finely bordered, lateral and posterior margins moderately bordered. Anterior angles rectangular, swollen, with setigerous pore in posterior half of swelling, posterior angles obtusangulate, with small pointed tip with setigerous pore. All pores bearing long pale seta, additional short setae visible on lateral margins of pronotum.
Elytra 1.50 times as long as wide and 0.72 times as long as body.

Length ratio of protarsomeres I, II, III and V equals
10 - 6 - 5-10
, of metatarsomeres I, II, III and V equals
14 - 7 - 5-10 .

Aedeagus symmetrical, parallel, with widely rounded apex, in lateral view almost straight. Ventral side with very shallow circular impression apically and shallow longitudinal furrow in middle part (
Fig. 101
). Internal sac as in
Fig. 126
.

Biology. Part of the specimens were collected on the flowers of
Miscanthus floridulus (Labill.) Warb. ex K. Schum. & Lauterb
( Poaceae ) and
Rhamnus formosana Matsum.
( Rhamnaceae ).
Etymology. The new species name honors Mr. Hou-Jay Chen, one of the discoverers of this interesting new species.

Comments.
Chûjô ( 1963 )
published
Calomicrus chujoi
from Taiwan and indicated a slightly different aedeagal structure from typical Japanese
C. chujoi
. Although we did not examine Chûjô´s specimens we have no doubts they belong to
Charaea houjayi
sp. nov.

Differential diagnosis.
Charaea houjayi
sp. nov.
is similar to
Ch. chujoi
from Japan . Males of both species differ by the structures of the aedeagi: the dorsal opening covers about two thirds of length of the aedeagus, impressions on the ventral side are shallow, the middle of the apical margin lacks the small tip directed downwards and the aedeagus in lateral view is almost straight in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
In
Ch. chujoi
, the dorsal opening covers only the apical third of the aedeagus and the impressions on the ventral side are deeper (particularly in the apical part). Also, the middle of the apical margin ends in a small apex directed downwards and the aedeagus is sinuate in lateral view (
Figs 101, 107
). The internal sac of the aedeagi differs as follows: lateral margins of flat sclerites rounded in
Ch. chujoi
but angulate in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
; dorsal brush of setae shorter in
Ch. chujoi
and longer in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
(
Figs 125, 126
). Females differ as follows: sternite VIII small and pentagonal in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
, rhombic with anterior margin incised in
Ch. chujoi
(
Figs 103, 109
); spermatheca with cornu C-shaped in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
and almost rectangular in
Ch. chujoi
(
Figs 102, 108
).

Among Taiwanese species
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
is similar to
Ch. sasajii
and
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
Males of
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
have the bodies more oval and larger ( 3.8–5.4 mm ), and males of
Ch. sasajii
are smaller ( 2.7–3.7 mm ) and subparallel. Females of
Ch. sasajii
are almost indistinguishable from smaller females of
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
based on external characters. Differencies can be found in the shapes of the spermathecae and sternite VIII (
Figs 65, 66
, 102, 103 ).

The males of
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
can be distinguished by the wider interocular space ( 2.60 times as wide as transverse diameter of eye, compared to 2.1 times in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
). Both species also can be separated by the structure of aedeagus, which is widely rounded apically in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
and distinctly pointed in
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
(
Figs 101
, 113 ). The females of
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
and
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
differ in the shapes of the pygidia (with semicircular incision in
Ch. maxbarclayi
sp. nov.
, widely rounded in
Ch. houjayi
sp. nov.
).
